title: What Does It Mean to Be â€œMedium Uglyâ€?

steps.title: Medium ugly describes someone who isnâ€™t conventionally attractive.
steps.content: Medium ugly describes someone who isnâ€™t conventionally attractive. If someone calls another person (usually a man) â€œmedium ugly,â€ it means they might not meet traditional beauty standards, but they have a charm or quality that makes them attractive to a specific person. [1] X Research source For example, TikTok user @ohmontaine made a video where he said, â€œNothing is more attractive to a hot lady than a medium ugly guy who makes her laugh like crazy.â€ Because the term was popularized on TikTok and X, people who use â€œmedium uglyâ€ typically belong to Generation Z, but Millennials and people in Generation X might use it as well.

steps.title: Medium ugly probably came from social media in 2017.
steps.content: Medium ugly probably came from social media in 2017. The exact origin of the term â€œmedium uglyâ€ is unknown, but because itâ€™s popularly used on social media channels like TikTok, it probably came from there. One of the earliest uses came from X user @KaylarWill , who wrote â€œI like my men medium uglyâ€ in reply to a Tweet on October 3, 2017. The next earliest use comes from X user @sighbrattt , who wrote â€œIâ€™m like medium ugly ğŸ™„ too fine for the ugly but too ugly for the fine ğŸ˜­.â€

steps.title: The term exploded in popularity on TikTok and X in 2022.
steps.content: The term exploded in popularity on TikTok and X in 2022. It wasnâ€™t until late 2022 and 2023 that people started using â€œmedium uglyâ€ extensively. Usually, this term is used to describe male celebrities online, but some people use â€œmedium uglyâ€ to describe others in person or to talk about the type of people they like to date. For example, TikTok user @dariapliu posted a video captioned, â€œnot him think that heâ€™s hot bc i chose him over others but my taste is medium ugly guys.â€ In another video, TikTok user @myhoangxx captured their friend running with the caption â€œthere will be hot guys at the party.â€ The user then runs past their friend, and the caption â€œthere will be medium ugly guys thereâ€ appears.

steps.title: â€œMedium uglyâ€ is not a compliment and can be insulting.
steps.content: â€œMedium uglyâ€ is not a compliment and can be insulting. If someone calls another person â€œmedium ugly" they find them attractive, but not so perfect that their beauty or looks are intimidating. However, this compliment is backhanded and can be upsetting or confusing. Itâ€™s best not to use this term to describe someone in person or online. Thereâ€™s been a ton of discourse online about people calling people â€œmedium uglyâ€ in person. For example, TikTok user @crazyjamjam says â€œLadies, I understand liking a boy thatâ€™s medium uglyâ€¦ but if you say that to a boy that you like, that would make me feel like sh*t.â€ If someone calls you â€œmedium uglyâ€ and you feel hurt by it, consider using an â€œI statementâ€ to let them know. [2] X Research source You might say, â€œI know you didnâ€™t intend to hurt me, but that comment really bothered me.â€

steps.title: â€œHot uglyâ€ is a person who is just shy of being drop-dead gorgeous.
steps.content: â€œHot uglyâ€ is a person who is just shy of being drop-dead gorgeous. Like â€œmedium ugly,â€ â€œhot uglyâ€ means the person meets beauty standards but may not be attractive to everyone. [3] X Research source However, the difference is that a â€œhot uglyâ€ person is more often seen as physically attractive, even though they may have one or two unattractive features. [4] X Research source Examples of celebrities who have been called â€œhot uglyâ€ include Zac Efron, Liam Hemsworth, Noah Beck, and Noah Centineo. â€œMedium uglyâ€ is closer to â€œugly hot,â€ which describes a person who isnâ€™t conventionally attractive but has a personality or confidence that makes them hot. steps.title: â€œMedium uglyâ€ emphasizes the beauty standards for men.
steps.content: â€œMedium uglyâ€ emphasizes the beauty standards for men. Beauty standards for women have been talked about for years. However, men are also victims of societal expectationsâ€”they may feel like they have to be buff with a six-pack to be considered â€œhotâ€ or â€œhandsome.â€ Using phrases like â€œmedium uglyâ€ throws harsh criticism on men who donâ€™t meet that standard. [6] X Research source Online, this can encourage people to label men as â€œmedium uglyâ€ who, offline, arenâ€™t considered ugly at all. Although beauty standards are changing to accept plus-sized men and men with more traditionally feminine features, terms like â€œmedium uglyâ€ may help to reinforce them again.
